In settings, we have a several different "Make an X" layouts.

  1. Each field on its own line:
    Screen-Shot-2022-02-04-at-10.09.55-PM.png

  2. All the fields on line line:
    Screen-Shot-2022-02-04-at-10.08.23-PM.png

  3. Tabs: Screen-Shot-2022-02-04-at-10.09.55-PM.png

  4. Whole panel: Screen-Shot-2022-02-04-at-10.11.27-PM.png
  5. Modal (for editing, but similar idea): Screen-Shot-2022-02-04-at-10.15.04-PM.png

We should figure out a plan for working towards consistency -- fewer patterns, and a clear set of guidelines for when to pick one approach vs. another.
I think (2) generally doesn't look great, and it's harder to make it work right in narrow windows (#20118).

Many of these panels also list the current X's, and there are tradeoffs between these approaches in how easy it is to get to the "make a new X" experience vs. how easy it is to see the list of existing ones.
Ideally our create-X interfaces should be similar to edit-X interfaces.
Our UI for letting users add bots is one of my least favorite UIs.

In terms of priorities want to replace category 2 in favor of modals; it's one of the few UI elements that is essentially unchanged since first hacked together in like 2013. The whole panels systems like 4 more make sense for a small number of things that are complicated and where it's useful to compare the new one you're making to existing ones -- the existing "Streams", and possibly a future one for "Groups".

The "Bots" UI (items 1 and 3) is also a pattern I'd like to replace, but I don't think it's as much a priority and wouldn't want to do it except in the context of a broader redesign of settings for bots. Which I guess is also true for the user groups one, but I think we're closer to having product reasons to really want to redesign the user groups UI.

So my proposal is that we plan to not make anything new like 1 & 3, and plan to replace everything that's currently style 2 with a modal. (With I guess the possible exception of "User groups" itself, which we might want to replace with something else).

So to be concrete, the half-dozen widgets like this one for adding emoji would be what I'd replace with a modal:
image.png

That said, one problem with that plan is that we don't want to make adding new emoji require a huge number of clicks, since folks sometimes want to do that in bulk. So for that particular one, we may want to make the modal support adding several without closing it? Not sure, since you can also do it via API, so another direction would be documenting how to do that in a page linked from the modal.
(I don't think that concern applies to any of the others, like Linkifiers)

I guess we wouldn't touch Linkfiers on the first pass, but for that one it seems helpful to be able to see existing linkifiers when you're creating a new one, which the modal approach doesn't really let you do. But maybe it's worth it anyway for consistency; we already have a modal for editing a linkifier.
Where should we put the "Add X" button that would pop up a modal (e.g. "Add emoji")? Just above the table on the same line as the filter for existing emoji? On its own line?
I think on the same line as the filter widget would be most intuitive; we might need to move the filter widget a bit to make it look nice.
Filed #21298 for the three "add X" widgets with multiple elements on the same line.

While reviewing @Ganesh Pawar (ganpa3) 's PR for migrating an "add X" widget to a modal, I realized that we should have a consistent structure for the modal title, field names, and buttons.

This modal has been added already:

Screen-Shot-2022-07-25-at-11.29.18-PM.png

And this is PR #22549:
180278349-97ed2d80-f8a7-466e-aa58-bf5e1d7b2b98.png

Heading

"Add a new X" seems reasonable. Any other suggestions?

Field labels

I think we should avoid using "new" in the label, so, e.g. the alert word modal would just label the text field as "Alert word". Does that sound right?

Buttons

How should we label the primary action button? I like "Add" better than "Save", but maybe "Add X" would be even better? This is not a modal, but we use that label elsewhere:

Screen-Shot-2022-07-25-at-11.33.15-PM.png

Thoughts?

Past discussion: https://github.com/zulip/zulip/pull/19097#issuecomment-887100007

I think we should avoid using "new" in the label, so, e.g. the alert word modal would just label the text field as "Alert word". Does that sound right?

Sounds good.

Ganesh Pawar (ganpa3) said:

How should we label the primary action button? I like "Add" better than "Save", but maybe "Add X" would be even better? This is not a modal, but we use that label elsewhere:

Past discussion: https://github.com/zulip/zulip/pull/19097#issuecomment-887100007

Mm, thanks! Right, I guess another option is to use "Confirm", as we do in lots of places already.
By the way, do we have a good place to document the decision once we have one (e.g., in https://zulip.readthedocs.io/en/latest/subsystems/index.html somewhere?)?
Oh, and we should be consistent about editing modals as well. "Save changes" looks to be our standard for the confirmation button.

I like "Add" better than "Save", but maybe "Add X" would be even better?

I'm leaning towards "Add" now, since "Add X" can be fairly long ("Add profile field").
"Add" or "Create" seems reasonable for this, yeah. Definitely agree with not including the type of thing in that label.
And I'm happy with the existing "save changes" for edit modals.
